main event: Several sightings of an unidentified object reported near Dayton, Ohio on January 7, 1957, which was later identified as the star Sirius.
interesting points: One sighting described an object moving westward towards the moon,At least two individuals reported seeing the object,Mr. Elmer Shambaugh from the Dayton Civil Defense relayed the sighting to the Air Force,The object was described as unshaped and bright with rays,No photographs were included in any of the reports.
sighted object: Unidentified object identified as the star Sirius
witness description: Witnesses included civilians reporting to the Dayton Civil Defense.
